intro: Blakea paludosa, commonly known as the swamp Blakea, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a velvety texture. Blakea paludosa thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
